e4: Recommendation is to switch from the current policy to the new one because it prioritizes transparency to an otherwise opaque financial report. Even though true EPS values would be reported without adding up any bias, stakeholders can make their own assessments using prior underreported information making room for fair treatment.
e5: For a reporting policy to be considered ethical, it should aim for transparency and honesty without intentionally misleading or deceiving stakeholders. In the context of ABC's financial reports, an ideal policy would involve accurately representing EPS values with clear explanations and justifications. Adjustments should ideally highlight future forecasts rather than historical underreporting. A fair and balanced approach that acknowledges prior shortfalls can contribute towards trust-building among investors.
e6: Yes. What mechanisms would be put in place to safeguard against similar cases of underreporting in the future, especially given the CFO's acknowledgement that it has happened previously?
